@flickr Top 25 photos of 2021 and Flickr Photos of the decade announced, and my images are in both.
But before I tell you more about this, I wanted to share a little story.
I started a Flickr account 6 years ago to store my photos and create a gallery of my favorite photos. I did not name photos; I did not tag them; I didn't share; I had 0 followers. But at that time, I didn't even think about it. After 4 months on Flickr, someone started following me, and it was a breakthrough. I wanted to know how on earth that person found me there. So I started joining Flickr groups and little contest they had. I became a community member, and a year later, I found that my son's photo running with geese was one of the most popular photos in 2015. In 2017, another photo of mine became the most popular photo there- the one of a boy next to a train.
A few days ago, Flick announced the TOP 25 photos of 2020, and I was delighted to find one of my photos there. One of my all time favorites: Adam and my cat sharing a unique and intimate moment. https://blog.flickr.net/en/2020/12/15/flickrs-top-25-photos-in-2020/

And there was more great news. Adam with geese, a photo was taken in 2015, was mentioned as one of the decade's photos with over 7M views. 
I can't thank enough Flick for all the years of support. I'm happy to be a member of this wonderful community! 
https://blog.flickr.net/en/2020/12/15/flickrs-top-photos-of-the-decade/

🏆🥇 IPA Awards Ist price 🥇🏆 
It was so nice to hear that I am the winner of the IPA 2020 award in the Category Still Motion/Video. 
https://www.photoawards.com/winner/?compName=IPA+2020

A few months ago during April lockdown, I decided to see if I had a chance in an international photography contest. When I saw the category name I immediately  thought of "The journey to the land of dreams video" that was created 2 years back. 

Let me share the story of the video...
When I started taking photos of my kids my husband got into filming and video editing. He got fascinated with 3d effects you can add to a photo that can make the images look 3D. And created a few of those videos for me.

 But 2 years ago on my Instagram account, I got an unexpected message. An artist from Grece @zamandizini sends me a sample video using a few of my photos to create a short video. My favorite winter shots with the music and the effects were so amazing I could not stop watching it. I showed it to my husband and he was also astonished by the effects. I asked Zaman to work with me to create a longer video.

Watch the full video on YT https://youtu.be/gIJlWCtQz_E

 I had a little script in my head. I chose the images to best fit my little story. The story was about children traveling in their imagination to a secret place. First, the kids wake up in a wintery scenery and they play and dream of the unknown. In their imagination, they travel by train and horses to find a little cabin lost somewhere in the show and find a treasure there.

I loved the video @Zaman created from my photos and I shared it on my Social Media, Tou Tube and everywhere I can. I also posted it on Bored Panda. My fans liked the video, I had a lot of very positive reactions. I shared it every winter and still had a lot of positive reactions. Now winning the 1st place in a contest I feel it had the appreciation it deserved. I hope you love the video as much as I do. #iphotoawards #winner #iwonapodlasinska #stillmotion #magical #christmas #themagicofchildhood

I’m uploading this image today to celebrate first birthday of this Instagram account. Some of you may remember that my previous verified ✅  80k account was stolen. Some of you may have even seen the stuff those thief’s were posting. But the worst thing was loosing contact with my followers, loosing all the messages and comments. Today after after a year of building this account I want to tell you a few things: 1. Awareness is the key. Being aware of the threat will keep you alerted so you can avoid this kind of site. 2. Always check the email address when you receive an email about any of your accounts like Instagram, Facebook, email account, Apple ID, Google account and others 3. Instagram has no real support team. 4. Having a verified account won’t make it easier if you loose it.

I was sitting in a sandbox with my younger one watching my husband swing the older one. Getting the shot was not easy because I was using a manual lens. But that’s not why it’s so important. And it’s not the fact that i have to hold my breath every time I look at it (as I was there on that swing). This was the time when I had a very difficult time with posting my photos online. I had a big breakthrough-an article posted about me and  my photos in a big national news portal. But I didn’t expect people to be mean to me about it. I felt like they were not getting only on me but also on my kids :my models. I had to stop and rethink the idea of posting photos of my kids. I stopped taking photos for couple weeks and this was my first day out with a camera. Despite my doubts I posted this on Flickr. Right after that I received an e-mail from Flickr team asking for permission to feature the photo on their social services! I was very happy and proud. When I uploaded this photo I never thought it’s going to be any special thing. I mean I liked it but the popularity of it was more than I could imagine. It was the most popular photo on Flickr in 2017. There were a lot of discussions on how it was taken (for example that it was a miniature train and the child was Photoshopped in 🤣) or on how it was edited. Well just to make it clear it was a real train and it was not moving. We had a permission to shoot next to it and there was no danger. The smoke was produced by the smoke machine snd the light was set on the train. But all that matters here was the boy precious pose and expression!
